solution is to not install tilt unlocker (even gitlab says its compatible)

LOG

Inside the KSRSS-Reborn.zip file you'll find a folder called KSRSS-Reborn, and inside of there is a folder called KSRSS and that's the folder you want to copy to your GameData. The final path should be GameData/KSRSS.

1 hour ago, OrbitalManeuvers said:

Inside the KSRSS-Reborn.zip file you'll find a folder called KSRSS-Reborn, and inside of there is a folder called KSRSS and that's the folder you want to copy to your GameData. The final path should be GameData/KSRSS.

geeeezz!...being caught in such a basic noob error....in my defense, there was no explicit info about it on gitlab

thanks!

Am I the only one who can't extract the mod file? I'd love to use this mod but I've gone through so many menus and installed so many dependencies, only for the files to be corrupted! Help?

2 hours ago, turnerjack698 said:

Am I the only one who can't extract the mod file? I'd love to use this mod but I've gone through so many menus and installed so many dependencies, only for the files to be corrupted! Help?

You might be ... no one else has complained about this, and I've certainly download it many times.

What are you downloading, and what makes you think it's corrupted?

14 hours ago, OrbitalManeuvers said:

You might be ... no one else has complained about this, and I've certainly download it many times.

What are you downloading, and what makes you think it's corrupted?

I'm downloading the folder, labeled "KSRSS" from github, once the file is being downloaded its name is changed to "KSRSS-reborn.zip" and whenever I open it, either a rightclick or with winrar, i get an error message "Unexpected end of archive", however i still have the ability to view the file. When I try to extract it, I get another message "This archive is corrupt". Soooo is it a stretch to assume something may be corrupted?
If at all possible, since this is the only file I've ever had this issue with, can someone just dropbox me the mod?

6 hours ago, turnerjack698 said:

I'm downloading the folder, labeled "KSRSS" from github, once the file is being downloaded its name is changed to "KSRSS-reborn.zip" and whenever I open it, either a rightclick or with winrar, i get an error message "Unexpected end of archive", however i still have the ability to view the file. When I try to extract it, I get another message "This archive is corrupt". Soooo is it a stretch to assume something may be corrupted? 

Ah ok, yeah we can probably help you. The first thing you'll need is the correct location: https://gitlab.com/ksrss/KSRSS  When you go to this link there's a control near the top page that should be set to "reborn" (it should be by default, I think). Once that's set correctly, there's a Download button over on the right. This will get you a zip file that you'll then need to unzip on your local drive, but *not* into the KSP folder. If you "drill down" into the folders unzipped from the archive, you'll find a folder simply called "KSRSS" - this is the mod itself. This one folder is the main thing you need to copy from the unzipped archive, into your KSP GameData folder. So you'll end up with a path like [main KSP folder]/GameData/KSRSS. No need to rename anything.

It's really best (by a long shot) to do this part first, before you have any other mods installed. Don't forget to delete the other thing you downloaded, especially if you put any of it into the GameData folder. So then add in KSRSS, get Kopernicus and its dependencies (mfi+harmony) and then you should have a basic KSRSS install. After you test it, then you can exit and get more stuff like Eve, Scatterer, and onward. 

If you need more clarification on anything just ask, lots of people here can help with install issues. Good luck, it's worth it
